intro: Lepidium boelckei, commonly known as the Mexican cress, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other well-known cruciferous plants. The plant features small, green, edible leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Lepidium boelckei is valued for its nutritional content and is used in traditional cuisines.
